member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AckConnectInfoMessage
member.summary: The DN_ACK_CONNECT_INFO packet is sent from the client/peer to the server/host to acknowledge the receipt of connection information. This packet contains no user data beyond the packet type field.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AckConnectInfoMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AckNameTableOperationsMessage
member.summary: The DN_ACK_NAMETABLE_OP packet is sent from the peer that is being queried for name table information back to the new host. It will include all entries missing from the new host's name table.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AckNameTableOperationsMessage.Entry.MessageId
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the internal message for the given name table entry.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AckNameTableOperationsMessage.Entry.OperationSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the size for the given operation buffer.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AckNameTableOperationsMessage.Entry.Operation
member.summary: A variable length field that contains the portion of the packet originally associated with the name table operation, except for the dwPacketType field, as indicated by the dwMsgId field. Each operation buffer is atomic to itself. For example, an op value corresponding to a dwMsgId field value of 0x000000D1 would contain the dpnidLeaving, dwVersion, dwVersionNotUsed, and dwDestroyReason field information from an original DN_DESTROY_PLAYER packet.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AckNameTableOperationsMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AckNameTableOperationsMessage.NumEntries
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the number of name table entries included. The dwMsgId, dwOpOffset, dwOpSize, and op fields are present in a DN_ACK_NAMETABLE_OP message dwNumEntries times.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage
member.summary: The DN_ADD_PLAYER packet is sent from the host and instructs peers to add a specified peer to the game session.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.Dpnid
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the identifier of the peer to add. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.DpnidOwner
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the identifier of the game session owner. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.Flags
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains player flags.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.Version
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the current name table version number.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.VersionNotUsed
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.DnetClientVersion
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the DirectPlay version of the client being added to the game session.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.NameSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the name. If dwNameOffset is 0, dwNameSize SHOULD also be 0. If dwNameOffset is not 0, dwNameSize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.DataSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the peer data. If dwDataOffset is 0, dwDataSize SHOULD also be 0. If dwDataOffset is not 0, dwDataSize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.UrlSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the connecting peer's URL address.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.Url
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains an array of characters that specify the client URL.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.Data
member.summary: A variable-length field that specifies a byte array of characters that contain user data.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.AddPlayerMessage.Name
member.summary: A variable-length field that specifies an array of wide characters that contain the peer name including the NULL termination character.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address
member.summary: The Address object contains generic addressing methods used to create and manipulate addresses for Microsoft® DirectPlay®.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address.ServiceProvider
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the service provider globally unique identifier (GUID) in the object.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address.NumberComponents
member.summary: Retrieves the number of components in the object.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address.Url
member.summary: Retrieves or sets the Microsoft DirectPlay address URL string represented by this object.

member.name: M:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address.AddComponent(System.String,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Adds a component to the address. If the component is part of the address, it is replaced by the new value in this call.Values are specified in native formats when making this call. Therefore, the parameter should be a recast reference to a variable that holds the data in the native format. For example, if the component is a , the parameter should be a recast reference to a . This method validates that the predefined component types are the right format.

member.name: M:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address.AddComponent(System.String,System.Guid)
member.summary: Adds a component to the address. If the component is part of the address, it is replaced by the new value in this call.Values are specified in native formats when making this call. Therefore, the parameter should be a recast reference to a variable that holds the data in the native format. For example, if the component is a , the parameter should be a recast reference to a . This method validates that the predefined component types are the right format.

member.name: M:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address.AddComponent(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Adds a component to the address. If the component is part of the address, it is replaced by the new value in this call.Values are specified in native formats when making this call. Therefore, the parameter should be a recast reference to a variable that holds the data in the native format. For example, if the component is a , the parameter should be a recast reference to a . This method validates that the predefined component types are the right format.

member.name: M:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address.AddComponent(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Adds a component to the address. If the component is part of the address, it is replaced by the new value in this call.Values are specified in native formats when making this call. Therefore, the parameter should be a recast reference to a variable that holds the data in the native format. For example, if the component is a , the parameter should be a recast reference to a . This method validates that the predefined component types are the right format.

member.name: M:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address.GetComponentBinary(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves information on the component at the specified key. Values for the component are retrieved in their native format. If the component key is not found, DPNERR_DOESNOTEXIST is returned.The value of the component is retrieved in its native format. Therefore, if the component's value is a , a is retrieved by this call. So buffer size = 4 and should be a recast .

member.name: M:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address.GetComponentGuid(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves information on the component at the specified key. Values for the component are retrieved in their native format. If the component key is not found, DPNERR_DOESNOTEXIST is returned.The value of the component is retrieved in its native format. Therefore, if the component's value is a , a is retrieved by this call. So buffer size = 4 and should be a recast .

member.name: M:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address.GetComponentInteger(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves information on the component at the specified key. Values for the component are retrieved in their native format. If the component key is not found, DPNERR_DOESNOTEXIST is returned.The value of the component is retrieved in its native format. Therefore, if the component's value is a , a is retrieved by this call. So buffer size = 4 and should be a recast .

member.name: M:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.Address.GetComponentString(System.String)
member.summary: Retrieves information on the component at the specified key. Values for the component are retrieved in their native format. If the component key is not found, DPNERR_DOESNOTEXIST is returned.The value of the component is retrieved in its native format. Therefore, if the component's value is a , a is retrieved by this call. So buffer size = 4 and should be a recast .

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ConnectAttemptFailedMessage
member.summary: The DN_CONNECT_ATTEMPT_FAILED packet is sent from the host to a connecting peer to indicate that an existing peer in the game session was unable to carry out the host's instruction to connect to a new peer.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ConnectAttemptFailedMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ConnectAttemptFailedMessage.Dpnid
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the identifier for the existing peer in the game session that was unable to connect to the new peer. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ConnectFailedMessage
member.summary: The DN_CONNECT_FAILED packet indicates that a connection attempt failed.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ConnectFailedMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ConnectFailedMessage.ResultCode
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the failure code.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ConnectFailedMessage.ReplySize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the data in the reply field. If dwReplyOffset is 0, dwReplySize SHOULD also be 0. If dwReplyOffset is not 0, dwReplySize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ConnectFailedMessage.Reply
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains an array of bytes that provides a reply message from the application identifying the connection failure. Reply data is only expected when the failure type is DPNERR_HOSTREJECTEDCONNECTION.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DestroyPlayerFlags
member.summary: Flag that controls how this method is processed.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DestroyPlayerMessage
member.summary: The DN_DESTROY_PLAYER packet instructs the peer to remove a specified user from its name table.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DestroyPlayerMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DestroyPlayerMessage.DpnidLeaving
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the identifier of the client or server to remove from the name table. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DestroyPlayerMessage.Version
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the current name table version number.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DestroyPlayerMessage.VersionNotUsed
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DestroyPlayerMessage.Reason
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the reason for terminating the specified client or server.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DnetVersion.DirectX80
member.summary: DirectX 8.0

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DnetVersion.DirectX81
member.summary: DirectX 8.1

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DnetVersion.PocketPC
member.summary: PocketPC

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DnetVersion.WindowsServer2003
member.summary: Windows Server 2003 operating system

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DnetVersion.DirectX82
member.summary: DirectX 8.2

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.DnetVersion.DirectX90
member.summary: DirectX 9.0

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.HostMigrateCompleteMessage
member.summary: The DN_HOST_MIGRATE_COMPLETE packet informs peers that the session-hosting responsibilities have successfully migrated from the departing old host.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.HostMigrateCompleteMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.HostMigrateMessage
member.summary: The DN_HOST_MIGRATE packet is sent from the new host to all remaining peers in the game session to notify them that a migration is taking place.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.HostMigrateMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.HostMigrateMessage.DpnidOldHost
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the identifier for the host that has just disconnected. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.HostMigrateMessage.DpnidNewHost
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the identifier for the newly assigned host that is in the process of migrating. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.InstructConnectMessage
member.summary: The DN_INSTRUCT_CONNECT packet instructs a peer to connect to a designated peer. This packet uses the CONNECT and CONNECTED packets defined in [MC-DPL8R] sections 2.2.1.1 and 2.2.1.2. For an example of the message sequence for these packets, see [MC-DPL8R] section 4.1.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.InstructConnectMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.InstructConnectMessage.Dpnid
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the identifier of the designated client to which the connection is being made. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.InstructConnectMessage.Version
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the current version of the name table.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.InstructConnectMessage.VersionNotUsed
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.InstructedConnectFailedMessage
member.summary: The DN_INSTRUCTED_CONNECT_FAILED packet is sent from a peer to indicate that it was unable to carry out a host instruction to connect to a new peer.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.InstructedConnectFailedMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.InstructedConnectFailedMessage.Dpnid
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the identifier for the peer to which the attempted connection failed. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.IntegrityCheckMessage
member.summary: The DN_INTEGRITY_CHECK packet is a request from a host to a peer inquiring whether the peer is still in the game session.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.IntegrityCheckMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.IntegrityCheckMessage.DpnidRequesting
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the identifier of the peer requesting this validation. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.IntegrityCheckResponseMessage
member.summary: The DN_INTEGRITY_CHECK_RESPONSE packet is a response from a peer to the host confirming that it is still in the game session.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.IntegrityCheckResponseMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.IntegrityCheckResponseMessage.DpnidRequesting
member.summary: Identifier of the peer that requested the validation. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.Local
member.summary: The name table entry is the local player.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.Host
member.summary: The name table entry is the host.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.AllPlayersGroup
member.summary: The name table entry is the All Players Group.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.Group
member.summary: The name table entry is a group.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.GroupAutoDestruct
member.summary: The name table entry supports group autodestruct.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.Peer
member.summary: The name table entry is a peer. In peer-to-peer mode, the name table entry representing the host of the game session is also marked as a peer.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.Client
member.summary: The name table entry is a client.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.Server
member.summary: The name table entry is a server.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.Connecting
member.summary: The name table entry is connecting.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.Available
member.summary: The name table entry is to make the member available for use.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.Disconnecting
member.summary: The name table entry to indicate disconnecting.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.Indicated
member.summary: The name table entry to indicate connection to the application.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.Created
member.summary: The name table entry to indicate the application was given a created player.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.NeedToDestroy
member.summary: The name table entry to indicate the need to destroy the player.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryFlags.InUse
member.summary: The name table entry to indicate that the player is in use.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo
member.summary: The DN_NAMETABLE_ENTRY_INFO contains a player or group that exists in a DirectPlay 8 name table. This includes all the information that the DirectPlay 8 Protocol: Core and Service Providers would need about a certain entry.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.Dpnid
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that specifies the DirectPlay identifier (DPNID) of the player or group that has been defined by the host/server. For more information about DPNIDs, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.DpnidOwner
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that provides the DirectPlay identifier (DPNID) for the owner of the player or group. When the DN_NAMETABLE_ENTRY_INFO message represents a group, that is, NAMETABLE_ENTRY_FLAG_GROUP is set in the dwFlags field, the dpnidOwner field MUST be nonzero. When DN_NAMETABLE_ENTRY_INFO represents a player, dpnidOwner SHOULD be set to zero when sending and MUST be ignored on receipt. For more information about DPNIDs, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.Flags
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that specifies the name table entry flags. Entries are OR'd together.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.Version
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that specifies the version number of the name table.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.VersionNotUsed
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.DnetVersion
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that provides the DirectPlay version.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.NameSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the name field. (Specified in section 2.2.1.4). If dwNameOffset is 0, dwNameSize SHOULD also be 0. If dwNameOffset is not 0, dwNameSize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.DataSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the data field. If dwDataOffset is 0, dwDataSize SHOULD also be 0. If dwDataOffset is not 0, dwDataSize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.UrlSize
member.summary: The size, in bytes, of the url field.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.Url
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a 0-terminated character array that provides the URL of a user in the game session. This field's position is determined by dwURLOffset and the size stated in dwURLSize, both fields in the corresponding DN_NAMETABLE_ENTRY_INFO structure. There can be multiple instances of the URL field, as defined by the number of DN_NAMETABLE_ENTRY_INFO sections that are included.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.Data
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a 0-terminated character array that specifies the user data. This field's position is determined by dwDataOffset and the size stated in dwDataSize, both fields in the corresponding DN_NAMETABLE_ENTRY_INFO structure. There can be multiple instances of the Data field, as defined by the number of DN_NAMETABLE_ENTRY_INFO sections that are included.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableEntryInfo.Name
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a 0-terminated wide character array that contains the client name. This field's position is determined by dwNameOffset and the size stated in dwNameSize, both fields in the corresponding DN_NAMETABLE_ENTRY_INFO structure. There can be multiple instances of the Name field, as defined by the number of DN_NAMETABLE_ENTRY_INFO sections that are included.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableMembershipInfo
member.summary: The DN_NAMETABLE_MEMBERSHIP_INFO structure contains information about a name table's group and player memberships. The number of DN_NAMETABLE_MEMBERSHIP_INFO structures in this packet is specified in the dwMembershipCount field.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableMembershipInfo.DpnidPlayer
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that specifies the DirectPlay identifier for the user. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableMembershipInfo.DpnidGroup
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that provides the DirectPlay identifier for the group. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableMembershipInfo.Version
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that specifies the name table version.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableMembershipInfo.VersionNotUsed
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableVersionMessage
member.summary: The DN_NAMETABLE_VERSION packet specifies the version number of the name table.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableVersionMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableVersionMessage.Version
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the current name table version number.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.NameTableVersionMessage.VersionNotUsed
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ObjectType.Client
member.summary: Connecting application is a client.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ObjectType.Peer
member.summary: Connecting application is a peer.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.PlayerConnectInfo
member.summary: Sends client/peer connection information to the server/host.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.ConnectFailed
member.summary: Connection attempt failed.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.SendConnectInfo
member.summary: The server/host response to a client/peer that contains game session information.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.AddPlayer
member.summary: Instructs peers to add the specified peer to the game session.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.AckConnectInfo
member.summary: Acknowledges (ACK) the receipt of game session information.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.InstructConnect
member.summary: Instructs a peer to connect to a designated peer.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.SendPlayerDpnid
member.summary: Sends user identification to another client/peer.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.InstructedConnectFailed
member.summary: Indicates that a peer was unable to carry out a host's instruction to connect to a new peer.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.ConnectAttemptFailed
member.summary: Indicates from the host that an existing peer was unable to carry out the host's instruction to connect to a new peer.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.TerminateSession
member.summary: Instructs the client or the peer to close and disconnect itself from the game session.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.DestroyPlayer
member.summary: Instructs the peer to remove the specified peer from the name table.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.HostMigrate
member.summary: Notified peers in the game session that the host is currently migrating.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.NameTableVersion
member.summary: Specifies the version number of the name table.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.ResyncVersion
member.summary: Requests that the name table version number be resynchronized to the current version number.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.RequestIntegrityCheck
member.summary: Requests that the host determine whether a target peer is still in the game session.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.IntegrityCheck
member.summary: Host is requesting a peer to validate that it is still in the game session.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.IntegrityCheckResponse
member.summary: Host is requesting a peer to validate that it is still in the game session.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.RequestNameTableOperations
member.summary: Sent from the host after a migration requesting the name table from a peer with a newer name table, if any exists.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.AckNameTableOperations
member.summary: Sent from the peer to the new host, acknowledging the new name table information.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PacketType.HostMigrateComplete
member.summary: Informs peers that the session-hosting responsibilities have successfully migrated from the departing old host.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage
member.summary: This is the first message passed into a host/server to initiate the connect sequence.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.Flags
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the connect flags.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.DnetVersion
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the DirectPlay version.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.NameSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the data in the name field. If dwNameOffset is set to 0, dwNameSize SHOULD also be 0. If dwNameOffset is not 0, dwNameSize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.DataSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the data field. If dwDataOffset is set to 0, dwDataSize SHOULD also be 0. If dwDataOffset is not 0, dwDataSize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.PasswordSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the password. If dwPasswordOffset is set to 0, dwPasswordSize SHOULD also be 0. If dwPasswordOffset is not 0, dwPasswordSize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.ConnectDataSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the connectData field. If dwConnectDataOffset is 0, dwConnectDataSize SHOULD also be 0. If dwConnectDataOffset is not 0, dwConnectDataSize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.UrlSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the url field. If dwURLOffset is 0, dwURLSize SHOULD also be 0. If dwURLOffset is not 0, dwURLSize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.GuidInstance
member.summary: A 128-bit field that contains the GUID that identifies the particular instance of the server/host application to which the client/peer is attempting to connect. Each instance of a DirectPlay server/host application generates a new unique GUID each time the application hosts a new game session. In order for the client/peer to connect, the value of guidInstance MUST match the value of the GUID instance defined on the server/host or the value MUST be all zeroes. If a different, nonzero GUID instance value is specified, the recipient MUST send a DN_CONNECT_FAILED message with the result code DPNERR_INVALIDINSTANCE (0x80158380) and terminate the [MC-DPL8R] connection. For information on how a client/peer retrieves the value of the GUID instance defined on the server/host, see the description of the ApplicationInstanceGUID field in the EnumResponse message defined in [MC-DPLHP] section 2.2.2.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.GuidApplication
member.summary: A 128-bit field that specifies the application's assigned GUID. This is the unique identifier for the specific application, not per instance.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.AlternateAddressDataSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the alternateAddressData field. If dwAlternateAddressDataOffset is set to 0, dwAlternateAddressDataSize SHOULD also be 0. If dwAlternateAddressDataOffset is not 0, dwAlternateAddressDataSize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.AlternateAddresses
member.summary: A variable-length field that specifies alternative address data used to connect the client. This field's position is determined by dwAlternateAddressDataOffset and the size stated in dwAlternateAddressDataSize. The addresses that are passed into the alternateAddressData field are formatted via the DN_ALTERNATE_ADDRESS structure. Because DN_ALTERNATE_ADDRESS contains its own size, multiple alternate addresses can be passed in by appending the DN_ALTERNATE_ADDRESS structures together. However, the maximum number of alternate addresses that can be passed in at a single time is limited to 12.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.Url
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a 0-terminated byte character array that specifies the client URL. This field's position is determined by dwURLOffset and the size stated in dwURLSize. It is defined in DN_ADDRESSING_URL.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.ConnectData
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a byte array that provides the connection data. This field's position is determined by dwConnectDataOffset and the size stated in dwConnectDataSize.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.Password
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a 0-terminated wide character array that specifies the application password data. This field's position is determined by dwPasswordOffset and the size stated in dwPasswordSize. This data is passed in clear text to the protocol layer.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.Data
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a byte array that specifies the application data. This field's position is determined by dwDataOffset and the size stated in dwDataSize.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.PlayerConnectInfoMessage.Name
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a 0-terminated wide character array that specifies the client/peer name. This field's position is determined by dwNameOffset and the size stated in dwNameSize.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.RequestIntegrityCheckMessage
member.summary: The DN_REQ_INTEGRITY_CHECK packet requests that a host determine whether a target client is still in the game session.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.RequestIntegrityCheckMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.RequestIntegrityCheckMessage.RequestContext
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the context for the request operation. Values for the dwReqContext field SHOULD be ignored by the recipient.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.RequestIntegrityCheckMessage.DpnidTarget
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the identifier of the selected target peer for the host to validate. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.RequestNameTableOperationsMessage
member.summary: The DN_REQ_NAMETABLE_OP packet is sent from the new host to a peer with a newer name table to request that the peer send back name table operations that have not yet been performed on the host. If no newer name table exists, this message is not sent.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.RequestNameTableOperationsMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.RequestNameTableOperationsMessage.Version
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the current name table version number of the host.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.RequestNameTableOperationsMessage.VersionNotUsed
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResultCode
member.summary: Result codes that can be returned via events.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResultCode.Generic
member.summary: An undetermined error occurred inside a DirectX subsystem. This includes uncommon errors that cannot be generalized.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResultCode.AlreadyClosing
member.summary: Server/host is closing or host is migrating.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResultCode.HostRejectedConnection
member.summary: Application declined connection attempt.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResultCode.InvalidApplication
member.summary: Application GUID is not valid for this application.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResultCode.InvalidInstance
member.summary: Instance GUID is not valid for this game session.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResultCode.InvalidInterface
member.summary: Nonclient attempting to connect to a server. Nonpeer attempting to connect to a host/peer.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResultCode.InvalidPassword
member.summary: Password passed in does not match what is expected.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResultCode.InvalidVersion
member.summary: Version passed in is not a valid DirectPlay version.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResultCode.NotHost
member.summary: Attempting to connect to an application that is not the host/server.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResyncVersionMessage
member.summary: The DN_RESYNC_VERSION packet is used to request that the name table version number be resynchronized to the current version number.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResyncVersionMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResyncVersionMessage.Version
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the current name table version number.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.ResyncVersionMessage.VersionNotUsed
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage
member.summary: The DN_SEND_CONNECT_INFO packet is sent from the host/server indicating to the connecting peer/client that it has joined the game session.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that indicates the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.ReplySize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the reply field. If dwReplyOffset is set to 0, dwReplySize MUST be 0. If dwReplyOffset is not 0, dwReplySize MUST NOT be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.Size
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the application description information. This includes all fields starting with dwSize through guidApplication.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.Flags
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that specifies the application flags.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.MaxPlayers
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that specifies the maximum number of clients/peers allowed in the game session. A value of 0 indicates that the maximum number of players is not specified.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.CurrentPlayers
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that specifies the current number of clients/peers in the game session.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.SessionNameSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the sessionName field. If dwSessionNameOffset is 0, dwSessionNameSize MUST be 0. If dwSessionNameOffset is not 0, dwSessionNameSize MUST NOT be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.PasswordSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the password. If dwPasswordOffset is 0, dwPasswordSize MUST be 0. If dwPasswordOffset is not 0, dwPasswordSize MUST NOT be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.ReservedDataSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the reservedData field. If dwReservedDataOffset is 0, dwReservedDataSize MUST be 0. If dwReservedDataOffset is not 0, dwReservedDataSize MUST NOT be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.ApplicationReservedDataSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that specifies the size, in bytes, of the applicationReservedData field. If dwApplicationReservedDataOffset is 0, dwApplicationReservedDataSize MUST also be 0. If dwApplicationReservedDataOffset is not 0, dwApplicationReservedDataSize MUST NOT be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.GuidInstance
member.summary: A 128-bit field that contains the GUID that identifies the particular instance of the server/host application. The value of this field implicitly SHOULD match the value of the guidInstance field specified in the DN_INTERNAL_MESSAGE_PLAYER_CONNECT_INFO or DN_INTERNAL_MESSAGE_PLAYER_CONNECT_INFO_EX message, unless that field contained all zeroes, in which case this guidInstance value informs the receiving client of the actual game session instance GUID.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.GuidApplication
member.summary: The application GUID as defined by the host/server.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.Dpnid
member.summary: A 32-bit integer created by the server/host that provides the identifier for the new client joining the game session. For more information, see DN_DPNID.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.Version
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that specifies the current name table version.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.VersionNotUsed
member.summary: Not used.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.EntryCount
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that provides the number of entries in the name table contained in the DN_NAMETABLE_ENTRY_INFO field below. These are in essence players in the game session.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.MembershipCount
member.summary: A 32-bit integer that provides the number of memberships in the name table contained in the DN_NAMETABLE_MEMBERSHIP_INFO field below. These are in essence player to group combinations.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.NameTableEntries
member.summary: This field contains a variable-length array of DN_NAMETABLE_ENTRY_INFO structures. The length of this array is described above in the dwEntryCount field. Each entry in this array describes a player or group in the game session. In peer-to-peer mode, the host MUST transmit entries for all existing participants and the new participant. In client/server mode, the server MUST transmit only two entries: one for the server player and one for the new participant.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.NameTableMemberships
member.summary: This field contains a variable-length array of DN_NAMETABLE_MEMBERSHIP_INFO structures. The length of this array is described above in the dwMembershipCount field. Each entry in this array describes a player/group combination.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.ApplicationReservedData
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a 0-terminated character array that specifies the application reserved data. This field's position is determined by dwApplicationReservedDataOffset and the size stated in dwApplicationReservedDataSize.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.ReservedData
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a byte array that provides the reserved data. This field's position is determined by dwReservedDataOffset and the size stated in dwReservedDataSize.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.Password
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a 0-terminated wide character array that specifies the application password data. This field's position is determined by dwPasswordOffset and the size stated in dwPasswordSize. This data is passed in clear text to the protocol layer.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.SessionName
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a 0-terminated wide character array that specifies the game session name. This field's position is determined by dwSessionNameOffset and the size stated in dwSessionNameSize.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendConnectInfoMessage.Reply
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a byte array that provides the reply. This field's position is determined by dwReplyOffset and the size stated in dwReplySize.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendPlayerDpnidMessage
member.summary: The DN_SEND_PLAYER_DPNID packet is used to send a user identification number to another client.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendPlayerDpnidMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SendPlayerDpnidMessage.Dpnid
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the identifier of the client/peer. For more information, see section 2.2.7.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SessionFlags
member.summary: Flag that controls how this method is processed.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SessionFlags.ClientServer
member.summary: A client/server game session.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SessionFlags.MigrateHost
member.summary: Host migration is allowed.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SessionFlags.NoDpnServer
member.summary: The DirectPlay enumeration server is not running.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SessionFlags.RequirePassword
member.summary: Password is REQUIRED.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SessionFlags.NoEnumerations
member.summary: No enumerations are allowed from the game session. This value is only available in DirectPlay 9.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SessionFlags.FastSigned
member.summary: Fast signing is turned on for the game session. Passed to protocol layer. Cannot be used with DPNSESSION_FULL_SIGNED. This value is available only in DirectPlay 9.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.SessionFlags.FullSigned
member.summary: Full signing turned on for the game session. Passed to protocol layer. Cannot be used with DPNSESSION_FAST_SIGNED. This value is available only in DirectPlay 9.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.TerminateSessionMessage
member.summary: The DN_TERMINATE_SESSION packet instructs the client or the peer to disconnect from the game session.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.TerminateSessionMessage.PacketType
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the packet type.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.TerminateSessionMessage.TerminateDataSize
member.summary: A 32-bit field that contains the size, in bytes, of the terminate data. If dwTerminateDataOffset is 0, dwTerminateDataSize SHOULD also be 0. If dwTerminateDataOffset is not 0, dwTerminateDataSize SHOULD also not be 0.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Core.TerminateSessionMessage.TerminateData
member.summary: A variable-length field that contains a byte array from the application that describes why the client or the peer is being terminated from the game session.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.GuardedByAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the synchronization object that guards this item.

member.name: M:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.GuardedByAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new object and sets the property.
member.param: The name of the sync object.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.GuardedByAttribute.SyncObjectNames
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the synchronization object that guards this item.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.GuardsAttribute
member.summary: Indicates the items that this synchronization object guards.

member.name: M:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.GuardsAttribute.#ctor(System.String[])
member.summary: Initializes a new object and sets the property.
member.param: The name of the sync object.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.GuardsAttribute.Items
member.summary: Gets or sets a comma-separated list of items guarded by this synchronization object.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectedMessage
member.summary: The CONNECTED packet is used to accept a connection request or complete a connection handshake when signing is not enabled.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectedMessage.Command
member.summary: A command-code bitmask that contains values that are combined by using the bitwise OR operation from the following table. The PACKET_COMMAND_CFRAME flag MUST be set. The PACKET_COMMAND_POLL flag MUST be set by a listener accepting a connection request and MUST NOT be set by a connector completing the connection handshake. All other bits MUST be set to zero and the packet MUST be ignored if they are not.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectedMessage.Opcode
member.summary: An extended operation code. It MUST be set to the following value:

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectedMessage.MessageId
member.summary: A message identifier. The initial value SHOULD be set to zero and SHOULD be incremented if the packet is retried.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectedMessage.ResponseId
member.summary: A response identifier. This value MUST be set to the value of the bMsgID field in the CONNECT or CONNECTED message to which this is a response.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectedMessage.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: The version number of the sender's DirectPlay 8 Protocol, in little-endian byte order, where the upper 16 bits are considered a major version number and the lower 16 bits are considered a minor version number. The major version number MUST be set to 0x0001; otherwise, the packet MUST be ignored. The minor version number SHOULD<2> be set to 0x0006 to indicate support for all features, including coalescence and signing.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectedMessage.SessionId
member.summary: The session identifier. This value MUST be set to the value of dwSessID specified in the CONNECT or CONNECTED message to which this is a response.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectedMessage.Timestamp
member.summary: The sender's computer system tick count, in millisecond units, specified in little-endian byte order.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectMessage
member.summary: The CONNECT packet is used to request a connection. If accepted, the response is a CONNECTED (section 2.2.1.2) packet or a CONNECTED_SIGNED (section 2.2.1.3) packet, depending on whether packet signing is enabled.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectMessage.Command
member.summary: A command-code bitmask that contains values that are combined by using the bitwise OR operation from the following table. The PACKET_COMMAND_CFRAME flag MUST be set, and the PACKET_COMMAND_POLL flag SHOULD be set. All other bits MUST be set to zero, and the packet MUST be ignored if they are not.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectMessage.Opcode
member.summary: Extended operation code. It MUST be set to the following value:

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectMessage.MessageId
member.summary: A message identifier used to correlate responses. The initial value SHOULD be set to zero and SHOULD be incremented each time the connect packet is retried. The recipient MUST echo the value in bRspId when responding.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectMessage.ResponseId
member.summary: Not used in connect packets. This MUST be set to zero when sent and ignored on receipt.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectMessage.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: The version number of the sender's DirectPlay 8 Protocol, in little-endian byte order, where the upper 16 bits are considered a major version number and the lower 16 bits are considered a minor version number. The major version number MUST be set to 0x0001; otherwise, the packet MUST be ignored. The minor version number SHOULD<1> be set to 0x0006 to indicate support for all features, including coalescence and signing.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectMessage.SessionId
member.summary: The session identifier used to correlate responses. The value is dependent upon the implementation and SHOULD be a random, nonpredictable number. This MUST NOT be set to zero unless dwCurrentProtocolVersion indicates a minor version less than 0x0005. This MUST remain the same value when retrying the CONNECT packet. The recipient MUST echo the value in dwSessID when responding.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.ConnectMessage.Timestamp
member.summary: The requestor's computer system tick count, in millisecond units and specified in little-endian byte order.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage
member.summary: Data frames exist in the standard connection sequence space and typically carry application payload data. They all are identified by having the PACKET_COMMAND_DATA flag (0x01) set in their bCommand field. The total size of the data frame (DFRAME) header and the application payload data SHOULD be less than the maximum transmission unit (MTU) of the underlying protocols and network. If larger messages are to be transmitted, the implementation MUST break the application payload data into multiple DFRAME packets, send the portions sequentially, and set the PACKET_COMMAND_NEW_MSG flag on the first DFRAME and the PACKET_COMMAND_END_MSG flag on the final DFRAME. Otherwise, the single DFRAME MUST have both the PACKET_COMMAND_NEW_MSG and PACKET_COMMAND_END_MSG flags. Application payload data that is split into multiple DFRAMEs MUST NOT be coalesced with other payloads.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage.Command
member.summary: Command field. The PACKET_COMMAND_DATA flag MUST be set. If the packet is a KeepAlive, the PACKET_COMMAND_RELIABLE, PACKET_COMMAND_SEQUENTIAL, and PACKET_COMMAND_END_MSG flags MUST be set. If the packet contains coalesced payloads, the PACKET_COMMAND_NEW_MSG and PACKET_COMMAND_END_MSG flags MUST be set. All other flags are optional.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage.Control
member.summary: Control field. The following flags can be specified.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage.SequenceId
member.summary: The sequence number of the packet.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage.NextReceive
member.summary: The expected sequence number of the next packet received.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage.SackMask1
member.summary: Optional low 32 bits of the SACK mask, in little-endian byte order. The existence of this field in the packet is dependent upon the bControl field having PACKET_CONTROL_SACK1 set.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage.SackMask2
member.summary: Optional high 32 bits of the SACK mask, in little-endian byte order. The existence of this field in the packet is dependent upon the bControl field having PACKET_CONTROL_SACK2 set.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage.SendMask1
member.summary: Optional low 32 bits of the send mask, in little-endian byte order. The existence of this field in the packet is dependent upon the bControl field having PACKET_CONTROL_SEND1 set.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage.SendMask2
member.summary: Optional high 32 bits of the send mask, in little-endian byte order. The existence of this field in the packet is dependent upon the bControl field having PACKET_CONTROL_SEND2 set.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage.Signature
member.summary: If the connection was established by using signing, this MUST be the signature of the packet using the agreed-upon signing algorithm. The packet sequence ID to be used in the calculation is the value in bSeq. This field MUST NOT be present if signing is not enabled for the connection.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage.SessionId
member.summary: The session identifier. When the packet is marked as PACKET_CONTROL_KEEPALIVE_OR_CORRELATE on connections reported as version 0x00010005 or higher, the dwSessID identifier MUST be set to the same dwSessID value specified in the CONNECT message originally associated with the connection, and there MUST NOT be any application payload data for the packet. Otherwise, dwSessID MUST NOT be present.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.DataFrameMessage.Payload
member.summary: Application payload data. The size of the payload field is the total UDP payload size minus the amount of data consumed by DFRAME headers up to this point. If the PACKET_CONTROL_COALESCE flag is set, the application payload data is not a single message or portion of a message; it is instead organized according to the coalesced payload format, as specified in section 2.2.3.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.HardDisconnectMessage
member.summary: The HARD_DISCONNECT packet is used to quickly disconnect or acknowledge quick disconnection without waiting for remaining packets to be delivered.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.HardDisconnectMessage.Command
member.summary: The command-code bitmask that contains values that are combined by using the bitwise OR operation from the following table. The PACKET_COMMAND_CFRAME flag MUST be set. The PACKET_COMMAND_POLL flag SHOULD NOT be set. All other bits MUST be set to zero and the packet MUST be ignored if they are not.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.HardDisconnectMessage.Opcode
member.summary: An extended operation code. It MUST be set to the following value:

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.HardDisconnectMessage.ResponseId
member.summary: The response identifier. This value SHOULD be set to zero, unless the connection is using PACKET_SIGNING_FULL; in which case, it MUST be set to the sequence ID of the next data frame (DFRAME) that would have been sent had HARD_DISCONNECT not occurred.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.HardDisconnectMessage.ProtocolVersion
member.summary: The version number, in little-endian byte order, of the requestor's DirectPlay 8 Protocol. The value SHOULD match the value previously sent in a CONNECT, CONNECTED, or CONNECTED_SIGNED packet, and MUST be ignored on receipt.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.HardDisconnectMessage.SessionId
member.summary: The session identifier. This value MUST be set to the same dwSessID value that is specified in the CONNECT message originally associated with the connection.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.HardDisconnectMessage.Timestamp
member.summary: The sender's computer system tick count, in millisecond units, specified in little-endian byte order.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.HardDisconnectMessage.Signature
member.summary: If the connection was established using signing, this MUST be the signature of the packet using the agreed-upon signing algorithm. The packet sequence ID to be used in the calculation is the value in bRspId. This field MUST NOT be present if signing is not enabled for the connection.

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketCommand.Data
member.summary: frame contains user data

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketCommand.Reliable
member.summary: frame is delivered reliably

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketCommand.Sequential
member.summary: frame is indicated sequentially

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketCommand.Poll
member.summary: partner acknowledges immediately

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketCommand.NewMessage
member.summary: DFRAME is first in message

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketCommand.EndMessage
member.summary: DFRAME is last in message

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketCommand.User1
member.summary: first consumer-controlled flag

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketCommand.User2
member.summary: second consumer-controlled flag

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketControl.Retry
member.summary: indicates whether the frame is a retry for this sequence number

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketControl.KeepAliveOrCorrelate
member.summary: protocol version levels of 0x00010005 and higher indicate that the frame is a keep-alive frame; version levels of less than 0x00010005 indicate a request for a dedicated acknowledgment (ACK) from the receiver

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketControl.Coalesce
member.summary: protocol version levels of 0x00010005 and higher indicate that the packet contains multiple payloads as described in section 2.2.3

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketControl.EndStream
member.summary: last packet in the stream; indicates disconnect

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketControl.Sack1
member.summary: low 32 bits of the SACK mask are present

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketControl.Sack2
member.summary: high 32 bits of the SACK mask are present

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketControl.Send1
member.summary: low 32 bits of the cancel-send mask are present

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.PacketControl.Send2
member.summary: high 32 bits of the cancel-send mask are present

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackFlags.Response
member.summary: bRetry field is valid

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackFlags.Sack1
member.summary: low 32 bits of the SACK mask are present in dwSACKMask1

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackFlags.Sack2
member.summary: high 32 bits of the SACK mask are present in dwSACKMask2

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackFlags.Send1
member.summary: low 32 bits of the send mask are present in dwSendMask1

member.name: F:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackFlags.Send2
member.summary: high 32 bits of the send mask are present in dwSendMask2

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage
member.summary: The SACK packet is used to selectively acknowledge outstanding packets. Packet acknowledgment (ACK) is typically bundled in all user data packets using the bSeq and bNRec fields found in the data frame (DFRAME) header. However, the SACK packet is used when a dedicated ACK is requested (that is, when the PACKET_COMMAND_POLL bit in the bCommand header field is set) or when no user data remains for further bundled ACKs.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.Command
member.summary: The command-code bitmask that contains bitwise OR values from the following table. The PACKET_COMMAND_CFRAME flag MUST be set. The PACKET_COMMAND_POLL flag SHOULD NOT be set and SHOULD be ignored on receipt. All other bits MUST be set to zero and the packet MUST be ignored if they are not.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.Opcode
member.summary: An extended operation code. It MUST be set to the following value:

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.Flags
member.summary: A status flag or flags. The value can be one or more of the following values. All other bits MUST be set to zero. The SACK_FLAGS_RESPONSE flag SHOULD be set and bRetry SHOULD be filled in properly.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.Retry
member.summary: Indicates whether the last received packet was a retry. This value MUST be ignored if SACK_FLAGS_RESPONSE is not set. The value SHOULD be set to zero if the last received DFRAME for the connection was not marked as a retry; otherwise, the value SHOULD be nonzero. Recipients MUST NOT require that any particular bit or bits be set in the nonzero case—only that at least one bit is set.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.NextSend
member.summary: This field represents the sequence number of the next DFRAME to send. SACK packets do not have sequence numbers of their own.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.NextReceive
member.summary: The expected sequence number of the next packet received. If the SACK_FLAGS_SACK_MASK1 or SACK_FLAGS_SACK_MASK2 flag is set, the bNRcv field is supplemented with the corresponding additional dwSACKMask1 or dwSACKMask2 bitmask field that selectively acknowledges frames with sequence numbers higher than bNRcv.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.Padding
member.summary: This SHOULD be set to zero when sent and MUST be ignored on receipt.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.Timestamp
member.summary: The sender's computer system tick count, in millisecond units, specified in little-endian byte order.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.SackMask1
member.summary: The optional low 32 bits of the SACK mask, in little-endian byte order. The existence of this field in the packet is dependent upon the bFlags field having SACK_FLAGS_SACK_MASK1 set.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.SackMask2
member.summary: The optional high 32 bits of the SACK mask, in little-endian byte order. The existence of this field in the packet is dependent upon the bFlags field having SACK_FLAGS_SACK_MASK2 set.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.SendMask1
member.summary: The optional low 32 bits of the send mask, in little-endian byte order. The existence of this field in the packet is dependent upon the bFlags field having SACK_FLAGS_SEND_MASK1 set.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.SendMask2
member.summary: The optional high 32 bits of the send mask, in little-endian byte order. The existence of this field in the packet is dependent upon the bFlags field having SACK_FLAGS_SEND_MASK2 set.

member.name: P:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.Reliable.SackMessage.Signature
member.summary: If the connection was established using signing, this MUST be the signature of the packet using the agreed-upon signing algorithm. The packet sequence ID to be used in the calculation is the value in bNSeq. This field MUST NOT be present if signing is not enabled for the connection.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.ThreadSafeAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that marks a class as thread-safe. This is only for documentation purposes and does not have any affect on the code's actual thread-safety.

member.name: T:Aigamo.Otsuki.Messages.ThreadUnsafeAttribute
member.summary: Represents an attribute that marks a class as not being thread-safe. This is only for documentation purposes and does not have any affect on the code's actual thread-safety.
